notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker with physical access to gain access to the operating system of affected devices.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities, such as:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Ensure there is physical protections in place to prevent the devices from any unauthorized access.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Encourage security awareness throughout the hospital staff to ensure clinical staff will report any unauthorized person trying to login or otherwise tamper with a medical device.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Educate employees on social engineering, both online and in-person/on-site.  This is often used to gain confidence to unauthorized resources.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Where additional information is needed, refer to existing cybersecurity in medical device guidance issued by the FDA.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploitation specifically targeting these vulnerabilities has been reported to CISA at this time. These vulnerabilities are not exploitable remotely.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

revision_history.summary: Update A - Added CVE-2024-1486, updated CVSS score for CVE-2020-6977.

product.name: GE Healthcare Venue, not including Venue 40 R1-3 and Venue 50 R4-5: vers:all/*

branches.name: Venue, not including Venue 40 R1-3 and Venue 50 R4-5

notes.text: A restricted desktop environment escape vulnerability exists in the Kiosk Mode functionality of affected devices. Specially crafted inputs can allow the user to escape the restricted environment, resulting in access to the underlying operating system.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: GE Healthcare recommends organizations restrict physical access to devices by unauthorized individuals. Additionally, where available, GE Healthcare recommends users enable the "system lock" password in the Administration GUI menu if possible. This will require a password to be entered before the system can be accessed.  The ‘system lock' would limit non-authenticated users from accessing the application.

GE Healthcare recommends that users with questions reach out to a GE Healthcare service representative and users with an active support account visit the GE Healthcare product security portal (login required).

notes.text: These ultrasound products are vulnerable to elevation of privileges via misconfigured access control list.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: GE Healthcare recommends organizations restrict physical access to devices by unauthorized individuals. Additionally, where available, GE Healthcare recommends users enable the "system lock" password in the Administration GUI menu if possible. This will require a password to be entered before the system can be accessed.  The ‘system lock' would limit non-authenticated users from accessing the application.

GE Healthcare recommends that users with questions reach out to a GE Healthcare service representative and users with an active support account visit the GE Healthcare product security portal (login required).
